column5: Went out for our last kick at the can for lakers and whities.  Nice and mild out there today and the sun made an appearance later in the day.  Paul had two on (and off   ) right off the bat, so things looked promising.  He was in good spirits even though he had just lost his second "fish on"     There were too many follows to keep count of, but not alot of "connections," although I did manage to keep this sweet lady on for a great fight  I won     And I got her on one of TJ's jigheads again, different colour this time.  Yay Due North Tackle     You will notice the line broke - whew, that was close!!!!         Caught a long distance shot of this big guy flying way down the lake.       The sun came out from behind a wall of clouds, just like that, cloud to sun, a nice, neat, straight line!!!      Met up with Nick (N.A.W.) on our way back and had a nice chat and made some possible future fishing plans     That was it for the fish.   On Saturday we traded our single trailer for a double and what a difference it made for packing (room)!!     Couple ducks at the parking lot.  Wish I had brought my good camera for these shots!           So that was our Sunday.  Really nice to be out there.  Guess it's perch from here on in   Hope everyone else had a great day
Ya, saw the Herc this morning, they did a para drop around 10:30.
I didn't see one.  Too busy watching my fishfinder I guess
Good to see you guys out there!  Nice pics as usual!
Couldn't of asked for a nicer day!!!!!,also great pictures as always!!
a great way to spend a spring day. thanks for the report
Great report Hon. Good to see Paul grinning ear to ear.  That's one heck of a trailer.....you'll be saving on cottage rentals now eh?
Great photo of the sun split!  Nick, that guy is everywhere haha.
Thanks guys.  And yes Roy, bet we could get a bed, dresser and a few other items in there for our summer camping trips
nice. How was ice near shore? I want to get out tuesday but am hesitant.

Ice near shore was fine.  We had no problems at all.  It was worse two weeks ago!  There was alot of ice piled up on shore in some places I noticed, so maybe it blew in from the east and made the west side better?
Nice report & pics Joey !!!! Great day to be on the ice for sure .....!!!!!! Nice laker too !!!!!
nice last kick at the can

Very nice photos Joey. That other camera must be very nice because these came out very well on this hi def iPad. Love the sun and cloud shot, really nice with the sled below the horizon. Going to copy it if you don't mind, it will go on my list of to do paintings, some day. As well that's a beauty laker.
Way to go Joey & Paul looks like you had a great day. I've had 3 skunk days up there walking and drilling nada except dink Perch. May giver one more shot before the season closes.
Great photos and 'Nice' day to be out!!  Perfect Laker for the BBQ.  Trailer looks great,   You can never have too much room.  Rick
Don't mind at all, would love to see the finished product
Glad you both had a great day out and to put one on the ice is even better All your equipment looks to be in tact this time .......another bonus lol  All the best in the soft water season.
NICE LAKER J. We had alot of chasers too.LOL
Thanks for sharing you day and those great pics with us, Joey!  Darn nice laker there, too.  Congratz.
Nice fish Joey!!!     Seems a lot of us were out there this past weekend.  Some awesome pictures as usual
Right on Jooooooooey!  Nice laker for ya... and I like that ride too.  Probably the best way to get around on Simcoe.
I dont know how I messed this.. Great REPORT!!! (and plug..)

Great report Joey.  That trailer looks like something I need to get for our trek to Bernie's.  Lots of room for all the instruments and fishing gear in that.     Beauty laker and pics too.  A nice closer for you guys as well.
